channel.title: Cursing on Tedium: The Dull Side of the Internet.
channel.description: Recent content in Cursing on Tedium: The Dull Side of the Internet.

item.title: Let's Get Profane
item.description: Today in Tedium: Profanity is good for the soul. It encourages you to let out frustrations that might have driven you crazy, and (if used correctly) it might just help you win an argument. These reasons were probably front of mind for Willian Barboza, who wrote three profanities on the traffic ticket that the city of Liberty, New York gave him. (He also changed the town’s name to “Tyranny.”) The result of that profanity—ironic, considering the town’s name—is that Barboza was arrested and jailed for the action.
